results.title: Picturesque Tasmania
results.creator_credit: G Gamon and Australia. Dept of Commerce. Cinema Branch
results.brief_description: Produced by the Cinema Branch, Australian Department of Commerce. A driving tour of Tasmania from Hobart along the western, northern, eastern and southern coasts focussing on the natural scenery. A number of towns and their various industries can also be seen such as trout hatcheries, the Mt Lyell mine, hops and apple growing. Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: G Gamon and Australia. Dept of Commerce. Cinema Branch

results.title: Spectacle Talks: Gotye and his Collaborators
results.creator_credit: Gotye, Mike Kenneally, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Multi award-winning musician, songwriter and producer Gotye is no stranger to collaboration. His music videos are a testament to this, utilising the talents of diverse directors, artists and animators. Often involving a range of complex animation and filmmaking techniques, visual worlds are created floating seamlessly against his music.
Natasha Pincus, Andrew Goldsmith, and directors of Rubber House animation studio Ivan Dixon and Greg Sharp disscus a selection of Gotye’s most renowned videos. These include ‘Easy Way Out’, ‘Seven Hours With A Back Seat Driver’, ‘State Of The Art’ and the international chart-topping ‘Somebody That I Used To Know’.
Hosted by film and music critic Megan Spencer, this event provided a fascinating insight into the collaborative journey, from initial concept and creative development, through to final clip production.

results.title: Show Me the Magic: The Adventures of Don McAlpine [Q&A]
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Cathy Henkel’s 2012 documentary ‘Show Me the Magic’ about Australian cinematographer Don McAlpine brought together personal and professional connections, including Gillian Armstrong, Bruce Beresford and Baz Lurhmann, to explore his life and career.

This question and answer session with Cathy Henkel and Don McAlpine, chaired by Rochelle Siemienowicz, was held at ACMI in September 2013 following a screening of the documentary.

results.title: Spectacle Director Showcase: Natasha Pincus
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Natasha Pincus is a multi award winning Australian music video director and producer and has won the ARIA award for Best Music Video two years in a row. Her stop motion animation video for Gotye’s ‘Somebody That I Used to Know’ has had a staggering 420 million views. Natasha talks about getting her first big break making a music video for Paul Kelly.

Created as part of “Spectacle : The Music Video Exhibition” 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014. ACMI Digital Programs worked with Exhibitions to interview five Australian directors featured in the exhibition about the art and techniques of music video production.

results.title: Spectacle Director Showcase: Oh Yeah Wow
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
‘Oh Yeah Wow’ are a Melbourne based creative collective that make music videos, short films and TV programs. In this interview directors Darcy Prendergast, Seamus Spilsbury and Josh Thomas discuss music videos.

Created as part of “Spectacle : The Music Video Exhibition” 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014. ACMI Digital Programs worked with Exhibitions to interview five Australian directors featured in the exhibition about the art and techniques of music video production.

results.title: Closure
results.brief_description: A young girl reflects on her connections with her family and friends and she attempts to discover why she feels like she is being ignored. She focuses on the experiences from her past but continually feels an intrinsic connection to water. Only later does she discover why this is the case.

results.title: Visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: Ethan Price, Ethan Hawkins, Riley Elson and Luke Breaden
results.brief_description: My name is Mick and I enjoy lots of exciting activities but not the activity of visiting Grandpa every Sunday. That is, until I find a photo album and discover I have more in common with Grandpa than I can imagine. Come and explore how two different people make a connection.

results.title: Soldier On
results.brief_description: Written from a collection of true stories, this film shows a boy of 15 years old delivering a message through an interview that must be heard and understood. Relationships are how we all connect in life, so make yours positive. Written, directed and edited by Billy Peters, performed by Conor Merrigan-Turner.

results.title: The Tank Gang: A Say No to Bullies Story
results.creator_credit: Willem Durrand, Tahalia Durrand and Ruben Durrand
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Tank Gang. The Tank Gang love playing together, even with Jack, the bully. One day, Jack goes too far and the Tank Gang see how putting up with Jack has meant that their friend got hurt. The friends all learn the importance of standing up for each other, not bullying and being good friends.

results.title: The Mansion [game trailer]
results.brief_description: It’s a moonless night… Let’s go explore a mansion. In ‘The Mansion’, a nameless character finds himself with the task of searching an old mansion. Although he can’t understand the lost children it doesn’t take a true connection to know only he can help. The story is told through a platformer format, inspired by games such as Super Mario Bros.
